intro: Macrocarpaea jalca, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a compact, mat-forming growth habit. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to the cold, arid conditions of its native habitat. Macrocarpaea jalca is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable climates.
